intro: Lomaria lherminieri, commonly known as the Mediterranean lomaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often found in Mediterranean regions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. Lomaria lherminieri is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
